project.teaser: To meet the increasing demand for transportation of both passengers and freight, FP2-R2DATO will take the advantages of digitalisation and automation to develop the Next Generation ATC and deliver scalable Digital and Automatic (up to Autonomous) Train Operation (DATO)...
project.objective: To meet the increasing demand for transportation of both passengers and freight, FP2-R2DATO will take the advantages of digitalisation and automation to develop the Next Generation ATC and deliver scalable Digital and Automatic (up to Autonomous) Train Operation (DATO) capabilities in order to enhance the capacity of the existing rail networks. Tangible results of FP2-R2DATO are expected to be delivered by 2025 on key topics: ATO, ETCS Hybrid level 3 and Level 3 Moving Block, digital technologies (5G-connectivity and a standardized onboard ICT-platform), and guidelines and methods for fast and cost-effective deployment and migration of DATO throughout Europe. Through these technical improvements FP2-R2DATO will meet the objectives and impacts defined in the ERJU Master Plan and Annual Work Program: contribute to increased punctuality, reliability and productivity of staff, rolling stock and infrastructure. FP2-R2DATO will pay attention to potential risks, such as acceptance by the public, synchronising with ETCS-deployment and potential legal issues, The overall methodology FP2-R2DATO uses to achieve the desired results is set-up along three stages: from the development of technical enablers, via prototypes that lead to dedicated demonstrators at TRL 6/7. The collaborative approach of industry suppliers, railway operators, infrastructure managers, together with research centres and academia FP2-R2DATO will ensure that each of the technical enablers will be developed at a reasonable cost and will match operational requirements as well as integration innovative technologies. Feedback loops are organised to align research centers, suppliers and railway operators throughout the project, to ensure the technology developed creates the impacts aspired towards a future digitised and automated European rail system.
project.title: Europe’s Rail Flagship Project 2 - Rail to Digital automated up to autonomous train operation

article.title: Towards digital and automatic train operation solutions

category.title: Project description
category.description: Article: description of linked project written by editorial team

result.title: Final Modular Platform requirements, architecture and specification
result.description: This deliverable will capture the final stage of the derived requirements on Modular Platforms, the derived architecture and specification, also incorporating feedback from the early implementation stages of the Onboard Platform Demonstrator in WP 36

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - FP2 - R2DATO (Europe’s Rail Flagship Project 2 - Rail to Digital automated up to autonomous train operation)
result.description: periodic
result.teaser: The FP2 R2DATO project focuses on leveraging digitalization and automation to enhance rail operations, particularly through the development of next-generation Automatic Train Control (ATC) systems, including fully autonomous train operations (GoA4). The project integrates...

webItem.alternativeText: FP2-R2DATO partners during a Remote controlled Tram Demo in Oslo

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Documentation of Freight specific user requirements for automation process
result.description: This deliverable will contain a set of documents defining user freight specific user requirements for all automation process subproject tasks e.g., automatic functions, ATO GoA 3/4 specification, safe perception system and remote driving

result.title: List of use case definitions and requirements
result.description: Requirements and use cases for development, engineering, commissioning, maintenance and refurbishment in the context of DevOps and architectural evolution

details.journalTitle: Proceedings of the 6th SmartRaCon Scientific Seminar SRC6SS

result.title: Operational Requirements and System Capabilities of ASTP System (Use Cases)
result.description: The deliverable summarizes the operational needs identified already in other projects outside Europe´s Rail and integrates necessary updates in order to ensure completeness as well as alignment with the System Pillar

result.description: This deliverable contains all the requirements specified and consolidated in the task 19.1

result.title: Intermediate Modular Platform requirements, architecture and specification

result.title: NG-TCN: Towards Network Slicing in on-board Wireless Train communication networks

details.journalTitle: Proceedings of the 6th SmartRaCon Scientific Seminar SRC6SS

result.title: Automation Processes collaboration map
result.description: This deliverable will provide a comprehensive list of interfaces and exchanged items between this subproject and other internal and external stakeholders

result.title: Set of requirements on the Digital Register in FP2-R2DATO
result.description: In this deliverable, all functional and non-functional requirements on the Digital Register, as needed by the various parts of the rail system developed in R2DATO, will be captured

result.title: Operational use cases collection
result.description: Collection of operational uses cases for demonstration of DATO in urban environment

result.title: Documentation of use cases for automating functions
result.description: This deliverable will contain a report about actual existing and specified automatedfunctions, tasks or related use cases with annotated target component as scope, a draft release for set of documents including analysis based on first input from SP and related Fas (e.g., regarding demonstrators) and definition for relevant use cases, operational parameters and scenarios in scope of passenger/freight and tramway applications

result.title: Autonomous Route Setting (AnRS) conceptual studies: use case list and concept definition
result.description: As a result of Task 48.1, this deliverable will provide the definition of autonomy in rail operation, use Cases, available or specified architectures, interfaces and technologies and required missing technologies. Track side concept, functional and technological concept as well as initial approach for demonstration for AnRS

result.title: Collection of test cases and validation criteria (WP42)
result.description: Collection of test cases and validation criteria for autonomous movement of tramways in depot demonstrator

result.title: Assessment of the need for an early EGNOS service
result.description: Assessment of the need for an early EGNOS service

result.title: Development of the Preliminary Stages for ATO Lab Prototype in Sight of a Future Inspection Vehicle

details.journalTitle: Proceedings of the 6th SmartRaCon Scientific Seminar SRC6SS

result.title: Requirements and specifications on the Data Factory
result.description: Requirements collection and specification of the Data Factory

result.title: Documentation of Use Cases for remote driving
result.description: This deliverable will contain a set of documents including analysis based on first input from SP and related Fas (e.g., regarding demonstrators) and definition for relevant use cases, operational parameters and scenarios in scope of passenger/freight/inspection vehicles and tramway applications

result.title: Driving the Future of Automatic Train Operation: A Focus on Intelligent Driving Algorithms

details.authors: Roger Idrovo, Paul Zabalegui, Sergio Arana, Jaizki Mendizabal; (CEIT)
details.journalTitle: Proceedings of the 6th SmartRaCon Scientific Seminar SRC6SS

result.title: Moving Block Specifications applying a train-centric approach
result.description: This deliverable will contain the results of the system definition (Task 13.2), requirements allocation (Task 13.3) and safety analysis tasks (Task 13.4)

result.title: Demonstrator specification
result.description: Detailed specification of the demonstrator, incl. requirements, logical and physical architecture, implementation plan, etc.

result.title: Documentation of use cases for perception system
result.description: This deliverable will provide a list of use cases and their expected behaviour which in turn will be translated to develop the requirements for the Perception system – required for Automatic Train Operation in Mainline/Regional Line/Stabling & Shunting, Freight and Urban/Light Rail applications

result.title: ATO GoA3/4 Specifications review documentation
result.description: This deliverable will contain a review of existing specifications and previous projects outcome. Analysis of gaps (e.g. for freight) and inputs from the System Pillar will be part of the deliverable too

result.title: Documentation of urban user cases and operational rules for automation process
result.description: This deliverable will contain a set of documents defining harmonized urban use cases and operational rules for all automation process subproject TE

result.title: Demonstrator implementation phase 1 concluded and test results consolidated
result.description: Summary of the implementation phase 1, incl. a detailed description of the implemented modules, a summary of the conducted tests and their results, and a consolidation of the key learnings at this stage

result.title: List of solution candidates
result.description: Concrete candidates of technologies for OSI layer 3-6 and for assoc. basic services

result.title: Lessons learnt report on approval processes for automated tramways
result.description: Guideline for future approval processes in urban environment

result.title: Consolidate prior research works incl. Proposal on integration of ACS components in FRMCS
result.description: In this report, it will be described how prior and ongoing activities on FRMCS and ACS relate, how a maximum extent of synergies among the concepts can be leveraged in the remainder of this WP, and how ACS concepts going beyond the FRMCS architecture and functionality can prospectively be integrated into the FRMCS system

result.title: Collection of test cases and validation criteria (WP41)
result.description: Collection of test cases and validation criteria for remote driving of tramways demonstrator

result.title: Increase Safety in Regional Networks with Decentralization - The Autonomous Route Setting Approach

details.authors: Lamm, Arne; Parrilla Ayuso, Francisco; Díaz Serrano, Paula
details.journalTitle: Proceedings of the 6 th SmartRaCon Scientific Seminar (SRC6SS)

result.title: Proposal on TSI202x, SS147
result.description: Proposal for Subset 147 of TSI202x for Onboard Communication Network (aka One Common Bus) on layer 1-6

result.title: Specification of the Digital Register implementation(s) required in FP2-R2DATO
result.description: In this deliverable, all concrete Digital Register implementations that will be needed for different demonstrators, and for other Technical Enablers such as Data Factory, will be specified

result.title: Analysis of applicability of solution approaches within the railway vehicle domain
result.description: Report on the applicability of approaches on evolvability from other domains, e.g. IT systems

result.title: HL3 System Specification with identification of use cases and related engineering rules
result.description: This document summarises the HL3 system specification, HL3 use cases and engineering rules

result.title: Documentation of Use cases, requirements & Specification autonomous operations for tramways
result.description: This deliverable will contain a collection of use cases to be covered by the envisioned and detailed list of functions and the system requirements of autonomous trams both in depot and in operation

result.title: System requirements of ASTP system
result.description: The deliverable defines the overall system performance requirements of the ASTP system considering the state of the art

result.title: Demo specifications
result.description: Definition of the objectives, test cases/operational use cases and validation criteria for DATO over ERTMS L3 demonstrator

result.title: Managerial Challenges in Implementing European Rail Traffic Management System, Remote Train Control, and Automatic Train Operation: A Literature Review

details.authors: Xavier Morin, Nils O. E. Olsson, Albert Lau

result.title: Definitive and aligned requirements set for Onboard Communication Network and Basic Services
result.description: Requirements including existing ones for OSI layer 1-6 on communication functionality of Onboard Communication Network and Basic Services

result.title: High-level consolidation of prior work and agreement on the Modular Platform specification to happen in FP2-R2DATO
result.description: This deliverable will provide a high-level consolidation of the prior work related to Modular Platforms and will capture the agreements of the partners regarding which aspects related to Modular Platforms will be specified within R2DATO

result.title: Testing reports & assessment (WP41)
result.description: Results of the remote driving of tramways demonstrator

result.title: DATO business case outline & required inputs specifications and scheme
result.description: Requirements (in collaboration with FA1 WP 8/9 and 15/16) for capacity simulation tooling and methodology (like development of Train Path Envelopes for ATO operations) to measure the potential impact of ATO/TMS-C-Das technology

result.title: IP assessment and Data Ownership Model
result.description: Proposal on a model for the data ownership

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
